result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard W Ulik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 1 day sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to restitution (payable to the victims listed in the criminal complaint).  PAID IN FULL.
Cash bail applied to costs/surcharges.  PAID IN FULL.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victims listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Case 15TR4751 is dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions, commencing FORTHWITH.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Richard W Ulik in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.
(2) Victims presented statements to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.




Court orders the following:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
1 Day Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent.
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victims (Crow Family) listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

RESTITUTION:  $187 (to be paid to the victim listed in the criminal complaint - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail to Restitution first, then this case and balance to be applied to 15TR4749.

CONDITION TIME: 
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - FORTHWITH.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
